answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
We are just in the process of implimenting our program.  ARRA funds distributed through the state were utilized.  The switch to CNG involves vehicle conversion costs (right now around $10k for trucks and vehicles, but more for heavy equipment) and the fueling infrastructure cost, this varies considerably, $150k - $500k for a smaller fast fill system.  The key issue being how much fuel you need and how quick.  Our system is a mix between fast fill and slow fill, we have started out with five vehicles.    Let me know what other questions you have.

author: Sara Jones
text:
The City of El Dorado, KS would like to convert a significant amount of municipal vehicles to compressed natural gas.  We need to know how other municipalities financed similar projects for refuse/recycle, police vehicles and public works.  We are looking to fund conversion of vehicles and the infrastructure.  Please tell us your combination of grants/loans (federal and in state of Kansas).
Also, we are interested in hearing about your methane recovery projects at landfills.
Thank you.
title: Compressed Natural Gas
